intro: Carex unifoliata, commonly known as slender sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. Native to wet or moist environments, it thrives in boggy soils and is often found in marshes or along stream banks. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and stabilize soil. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
